definition: flight of steps/(fig.) a means of advancement/stepping stone

sentences.english: Density of uterus gland gradually drops uterus horn near ovary to uterus body.
sentences.chinese: 子宫腺密度从卵巢端到子宫体端呈阶梯下降。
房屋入口处的天桥和阶梯外观。

sentences.english: You can even slip them into the wall to build a step shelf-like design.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可以把它们插到墙壁里变成一个阶梯式的架子。

sentences.english: Are you trying to climb the ladder of success in your career?
sentences.chinese: 你是否致力于攀登事业成功的阶梯？

sentences.english: The model of Plato's Ladder aptly describes the logic behind the theory.
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图的阶梯模型恰当地描述了三段论所蕴含的逻辑。

sentences.english: A candidate judge is the first step on the international judges' ladder.
sentences.chinese: 国际裁判等级阶梯的第一级是候选裁判。

sentences.english: Ask workers to help pick up unsolicited flyers left on your doorstep.
sentences.chinese: 请工人们帮忙捡起门口阶梯上不请自来的传单。

sentences.english: Constellation rooms come with an alfresco terrace tub.
sentences.chinese: 以星座命名的房间佩有露天阶梯式浴盆。

sentences.english: She skipped up flights of stairs to the tower.
sentences.chinese: 她一蹦一跳地踏着阶梯往塔上走去。

sentences.english: Women want men that appear high on the social ladder.
sentences.chinese: 女人想要在社会阶梯中显得高高在上的男人。

sentences.english: There were steps along the way, a stairway, in effect.
sentences.chinese: 石径上有着一个个台阶，简直就是一道阶梯。

sentences.english: The steps are slippery with ice.
sentences.chinese: 这些阶梯因有冰而很滑。

sentences.english: Thundering Rocks, Stairway to Heaven, Hallelujah Mountaints (floating mountains) – Iknimaya.
sentences.chinese: 悬浮的山，哈利路亚山，通往天堂的阶梯。

sentences.english: In the capture trails system a multi-level ring ladder type of multiple-order computers is adopted.
sentences.chinese: 该系统采用多层环阶梯式多级计算机控制。

sentences.english: We climb a ladder and each time we get up to another rung we forget about the rungs below.
sentences.chinese: 我们爬梯子时，每当上了一个阶梯就会忘了下面的。

sentences.english: They bolted down the gangway and took their tickets.
sentences.chinese: 他们跑下阶梯，买好了票。

definition: steps/flight of steps/step (over obstacle)/fig. way out of an embarrassing situation/bench (geology)
to walk slowly up a flight of steps (idiom)
to climb/to pull oneself up/to clamber/to scale/fig. to forge ahead in the face of hardships and danger
winding corridor/cloister/ambulatory (covered walkway around a cloister)
top floor/the top of a building
stride/to step (on the spot)/to mark time/at a standstill
